>
[Sloughing Toxin](/Equipment.aspx?ID=929)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Abomination Vaults</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Alchemical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=6" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Injury" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=97" />
<trait label="Poison" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=126" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #164: Hands of the Devil](/Sources.aspx?ID=75) pg. 72</row>

**Price** 60 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 2 hands

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Two Actions" /><row>Interact</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This complex toxin makes the muscles beneath a creature's skin loose and malleable, which fleshwarpers find useful in their work. Rough or jerky movements the victim performs concentrate the toxin in subdermal muscles and eventually cause skin and muscle to slough away.

 **Saving Throw** DC 25 Fortitude; **Onset** 1 round; **Maximum Duration** 1 hour; **Stage 1** 1d6 poison damage for each action with the [attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15) or [move](/Traits.aspx?ID=114) trait the victim uses (1 round); **Stage 2** 1d6 poison damage and 1d6 slashing damage for each action with the attack, [manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104), or move trait the victim uses (1 round); **Stage 3** as Stage 2, but 1d6 poison damage and 2d6 slashing damage, and forced movement also causes damage (1 hour)

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
